title: Authors and Citation
text: Almeida-Silva F (2022). tidyproj: Create standard project structure reproducible research. R package version 0.99.0, https://github.com/almeidasilvaf/tidyproj.
code: @Manual{,   title = {tidyproj: Create a standard project structure for reproducible research},   author = {Fabrício Almeida-Silva},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.99.0},   url = {https://github.com/almeidasilvaf/tidyproj}, }

what: Create a standard project structure for reproducible research
title: Create a standard project structure for reproducible research
text: goal tidyproj create standard directory structure scientific projects, including code, data, products directory. way, projects look , making easier load save data different projects. can see example directory created tidyproj inst/extdata. directory structure looks like :
code: exampledir <- system.file("extdata", "exampledir", package = "tidyproj") fs::dir_tree(exampledir) #> /home/faalm/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.2/tidyproj/extdata/exampledir #> ├── code #> │   ├── 01_first_analysis.Rmd #> │   ├── 02_second_analysis.Rmd #> │   ├── 03_third_analysis.Rmd #> │   └── 04_fourth_analysis.Rmd #> ├── data #> │   └── DATA_DESCRIPTION.Rmd #> └── products #>     ├── figs #>     ├── plots #>     ├── result_files #>     └── tables

title: Create a standard project structure for reproducible research
Create project tree — create_project_tree
text: function creates standard directory structure scientific projects.

title: Create project tree — create_project_tree
text: rootdir Path root directory structure created. Default: ::().

what: Create an .Rmd file for code — create_rmd
title: Create an .Rmd file for code — create_rmd
Create an .Rmd file for code — create_rmd
Create an .Rmd file for code — create_rmd
text: rootdir Path root directory created create_project_tree(). Default: ::(). Default: ::(). filename Character specifying name .Rmd file created. Default: 0_new_code_file.Rmd.

title: Create an .Rmd file for code — create_rmd
Create an .Rmd file for code — create_rmd
code: rootdir <- file.path(tempdir(), "tidyproj_example") c <- create_project_tree(rootdir) #> /tmp/RtmpMkFUfy/tidyproj_example #> ├── code #> │   ├── 01_first_analysis.Rmd #> │   ├── 02_second_analysis.Rmd #> │   ├── 03_third_analysis.Rmd #> │   └── 04_fourth_analysis.Rmd #> ├── data #> │   └── DATA_DESCRIPTION.Rmd #> └── products #>     ├── figs #>     ├── plots #>     ├── result_files #>     └── tables  # Create file fname <- paste0(sample(1:100, 1), "_new_analysis.Rmd") file <- create_rmd(rootdir, filename = fname)

title: tidyproj 0.99.0
text: NEW FEATURES Added NEWS.md file track changes package.
